Name: L'Anse aux Meadows National Historic Site
Description: L'Anse aux Meadows National Historic Site - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Only authenticated Norse site in North America, evidence of Viking presence around 1000 CE.

Name: Nahanni National Park
Description: Nahanni National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Remote wilderness with Virginia Falls, deep canyons, and pristine rivers in the Mackenzie Mountains.

Name: Dinosaur Provincial Park
Description: Dinosaur Provincial Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. One of the world's richest dinosaur fossil sites with over 150 complete skeletons discovered.

Name: Kluane / Wrangell-St. Elias / Glacier Bay / Tatshenshini-Alsek
Description: Kluane National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Transboundary park with Canada's highest peak (Mount Logan) and vast icefields.

Name: Head-Smashed-In Buffalo Jump
Description: Head-Smashed-In Buffalo Jump - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Prehistoric buffalo hunting site used for over 5,500 years by Indigenous peoples.

Name: SGang Gwaay
Description: SGang Gwaay (Anthony Island) - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Haida village site with the largest collection of Haida totem poles in their original locations.

Name: Wood Buffalo National Park
Description: Wood Buffalo National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Canada's largest national park, home to the world's largest free-roaming bison herd.

Name: Canadian Rocky Mountain Parks
Description: Canadian Rocky Mountain Parks - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Seven parks including Banff, Jasper, Kootenay, and Yoho showcasing stunning mountain landscapes.

Name: Historic District of Old Québec
Description: Historic District of Old Québec - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Only fortified city north of Mexico, preserving French colonial architecture and fortifications.

Name: Gros Morne National Park
Description: Gros Morne National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Spectacular fjords, mountains, and geological formations showcasing plate tectonics.

Name: Old Town Lunenburg
Description: Old Town Lunenburg - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Best surviving example of a planned British colonial settlement in North America.

Name: Waterton-Glacier International Peace Park
Description: Waterton-Glacier International Peace Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Transboundary park combining Waterton Lakes (Canada) and Glacier (US) National Parks.

Name: Miguasha National Park
Description: Miguasha National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Exceptional fossil site from the Devonian period, known as the 'Age of Fishes'.

Name: Rideau Canal
Description: Rideau Canal - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Best-preserved example of a slackwater canal in North America, built in the early 19th century.

Name: Joggins Fossil Cliffs
Description: Joggins Fossil Cliffs - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Exceptional fossil record from the Carboniferous period, known as the 'Coal Age'.

Name: Landscape of Grand Pré
Description: Landscape of Grand Pré - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Agricultural landscape developed by Acadian settlers using innovative dyking techniques.

Name: Red Bay Basque Whaling Station
Description: Red Bay Basque Whaling Station - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Best-preserved example of 16th-century Basque whaling stations in North America.

Name: Mistaken Point
Description: Mistaken Point - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Exceptional fossil site containing the oldest known evidence of multicellular life on Earth.

Name: Pimachiowin Aki
Description: Pimachiowin Aki - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Boreal forest landscape managed by Anishinaabe First Nations, combining natural and cultural values.

Name: Writing-on-Stone / Áísínai'pi
Description: Writing-on-Stone / Áísínai'pi - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Sacred Blackfoot site with thousands of petroglyphs and pictographs.

Name: Tr'ondëk-Klondike
Description: Tr'ondëk-Klondike - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Cultural landscape associated with the Klondike Gold Rush and Tr'ondëk Hwëch'in First Nation.
